definition: weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The user name and password combo provide a point of weakness.
sentences.chinese: 用戶名和密碼的組合帶來了一個弱點。

sentences.english: Call it my weakness. Call it kindness, " one brigadier told The Guardian.
sentences.chinese: 那是我的弱點，我的善良，”一個准將告訴《衛報》。

sentences.english: For many young people their ego, or over-confidence, could be their Achilles' heel.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人的弱點也許是自負，過於的自信。

sentences.english: They leapfrogged the enemy's main force and struck at his weak points.
sentences.chinese: 他們避開敵人主力而打擊其薄弱點。

sentences.english: However, Deke has trouble matching up against faster-paced teams.
sentences.chinese: 但木大叔在快攻體系下有明顯的弱點。

sentences.english: But right now, I want to focus on four of Kobe's on-court weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 不過現在，我只想說說科比在場上的四處弱點。

sentences.english: The inspector was able to put his finger on the weak point in the suspect's alibi.
sentences.chinese: 檢察官能準確指出嫌疑人辯辭中的弱點。

sentences.english: There are obvious weakness in tradional government accounting system in China.
sentences.chinese: 中國現行政府會計存在一系列弱點。

sentences.english: The dark's true Achilles heel is the torpedoed monetary system which is on its last legs.
sentences.chinese: 黑暗勢力的真實弱點是他們的貨幣系統。

sentences.english: River channels indicate a weak point in the crust, a point where pulling apart is most likely to happen.
sentences.chinese: 河道指明瞭地殼的薄弱點，那裏最可能發生撕裂。

sentences.english: We all have our little weakness.
The attenuation weak spot is the black strip in the lower left corner of the band.
sentences.chinese: 天線的衰減弱點就是鋼圈左下角的黑色覆蓋物。

sentences.english: Their Achilles heelis that they shy away from conflict.
sentences.chinese: 他們的弱點在於他們避開衝突。

sentences.english: The god Apollo, however, knew of Achilles’ weak spot and told Paris about it.
sentences.chinese: 然而阿波羅神卻知道阿奇里斯的弱點並告訴了帕里斯。

sentences.english: British weakness was underlined when the French fleet escaped from Toulon.
sentences.chinese: 法國艦隊從土倫逃遁一事反映出了英國的弱點。

sentences.english: Two final problems illuminate the nation's vulnerability to disasters.
sentences.chinese: 最後兩個問題闡明瞭這個國家面對災難時的弱點。

definition: to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
